paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variant information and penetrance data from the paper.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The average risk of breast cancer by the age of 70 years is similar for carriers of the BRCA1 c.68_69delAG and c.5266dupC mutations (64% and 67% respectively), however is much lower for the c.5946delT mutation (43%).

functional_data.summary: The c.5946delT mutation is associated with a lower risk of breast cancer compared to other founder mutations.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is part of routine clinical practice for Ashkenazi Jewish individuals.
key_quotes: These 3 mutations (BRCA1 c.68_69delAG, c.5266dupC and BRCA2 c.5946delT) account for 98–99% of identified mutations and are carried by about 2.6% (1/40) of the Ashkenazi Jewish population.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The c.7806-2A>G in the BRCA2 gene appears to be an unique founder mutation in the Slovenian population, found in 26% (10/38) of all BRCA1/2 mutations harboring families.

functional_data.summary: The c.7806-2A>G mutation is associated with a significant risk of breast and ovarian cancer.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: 26% in BRCA1/2 positive families in Slovenia
variants.additional_notes: This mutation accounts for a significant proportion of BRCA1/2 mutations in Slovenia.
key_quotes: These 5 mutations account for 67% of the BRCA1/2 positive families.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
